identificationModule.briefTitle: Clinical Hemodynamic Study of Balloon Counterpulsation in Advanced Heart Failure
identificationModule.officialTitle: Clinical Hemodynamic Study of Balloon Counterpulsation in Advanced Heart Failure

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The primary objective of this study is to develop normative hemodynamic data (means and standard deviations) for the intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP) using pressure-volume loop and 3D-echocardiographic analyses.

armGroups.label: IABP recipient
armGroups.description: Referred for clinically indicated right heart catheterization with intervention of IABP placement prior to LVAD surgery.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Control subjects undergoing left heart catheterization with an LV ejection fraction \> 50%, and without a history of heart failure symptoms who did not receive IABP therapy were enrolled.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Impact of Intra-aortic Balloon Pump Activation on Left Ventricular Stroke Work.
primaryOutcomes.description: We will be measuring left ventricular stroke work using a conductance catheter before and immediately after activation of an intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP). Left ventricular stroke work is quantified as the product of left ventricular pressure and volume. Conductance catheters are the primary method available for clinical measurement of left ventricular volume and pressure.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male or females between 18-75 years of age
* NYHA Class III-IV heart failure at the time of MEGA deployment
* Stage C-D systolic heart failure
* Non-ischemic cardiomyopathy
* Preserved right ventricular function defined by 2D-echocardiography
* Clinically indicated left and right heart catheterization and MEGA-IABP placement
* Clinically indicated MEGA-IABP support for 12 hours minimum

Exclusion Criteria:

* Ischemic cardiomyopathy
* Active myocardial ischemia or acute coronary syndrome
* Severe peripheral vascular disease
* Severe aortic or mitral valve insufficiency
* Severe aortic or mitral valve stenosis
* Right ventricular failure
* Inability to tolerate left and right heart catheterization
* Severe hemodynamic instability defined as a systolic BP \<80mmHg despite vasopressor/inotropic support
* Sustained ventricular tachycardia (\>10 beats) within 24 hours and/or ventricular fibrillation within 24 hours
* Pacemaker dependent rhythm
* Left ventricular thrombus
* Rapid atrial fibrillation (HR\>120 bpm)
* Unable to provide informed consent
* Pregnancy

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: 10 patients with advanced HF from 2014 to 2015 at Tufts Medical Center referred for clinically indicated RHC and IABP placement prior to LVAD surgery. Five control subjects undergoing left heart catheterization with an LV ejection fraction \> 50%, and without a history of heart failure symptoms who did not receive IABP therapy were enrolled.

groups.title: IABP Recipient
groups.description:
Prospective, double-arm, pilot study.

Conductance catheterization: CD Leycom Conductance Catheter
